intro: Fimbristylis bivalvis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown and are surrounded by bracts. Fimbristylis bivalvis plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along stream banks.
